description: As of November 2024, Melanie Hopkins is Acting Consul General at the British Consulate General in New York. Previously, she was Deputy Consul General in New York. Prior, Melanie served as Deputy Head of Mission in Brazil from July 2021 to July 2024. Between February and November 2022, she took on the role of Chargé d’Affaires (Acting Ambassador). Her previous role was as British High Commissioner to Fiji (and non-resident Ambassador/High Commissioner to a number of other Pacific countries) and Head of the UK’s network of 5 diplomatic missions. Previously she has worked on multilateral and bilateral policy (including security policy), programme management and finance. She joined the Civil Service in 2002 after beginning her career in Management Consultancy. Curriculum vitae Full name: Melanie Hopkins Date Role December 2022 to June 2024 Deputy Head of Mission, Brasilia March to November 2022 Chargé d’Affaires (Acting Ambassador), Brasilia 2021 to March 2022 Deputy Head of Mission, Brasilia 2016 to 2020 British High Commissioner, Fiji 2014 to 2016 Foreign & Commonwealth Office (FCO) Deputy Head (European Security), Security Policy Dept 2012 to 2014 FCO, Head of Australasia and Pacific, Asia Pacific Department 2012 FCO, Head of Common Security & Defence Policy, Europe Directorate 2008 to 2011 UK Mission to the UN Geneva, Second Secretary 2004 to 2007 Havana, Head of Political Section and Press & Public Affairs 2004 Secondment to the Spanish Ministry of Foreign Affairs 2003 to 2004 FCO, Desk Officer for Turkey, Europe Directorate 2002 to 2003 FCO, Desk Officer, Capital Unit, Finance Directorate 2002 Joined FCO 1997 to 2002 Private sector

details.body:
As of November 2024, Melanie Hopkins is Acting Consul General at the British Consulate General in New York. Previously, she was Deputy Consul General in New York.

Prior, Melanie served as Deputy Head of Mission in Brazil from July 2021 to July 2024. Between February and November 2022, she took on the role of Chargé d’Affaires (Acting Ambassador).

Her previous role was as British High Commissioner to Fiji (and non-resident Ambassador/High Commissioner to a number of other Pacific countries) and Head of the UK’s network of 5 diplomatic missions. Previously she has worked on multilateral and bilateral policy (including security policy), programme management and finance. She joined the Civil Service in 2002 after beginning her career in Management Consultancy.

Curriculum vitae

Full name: Melanie Hopkins

Date Role
December 2022 to June 2024 Deputy Head of Mission, Brasilia
March to November 2022 Chargé d’Affaires (Acting Ambassador), Brasilia
2021 to March 2022 Deputy Head of Mission, Brasilia
2016 to 2020 British High Commissioner, Fiji
2014 to 2016 Foreign & Commonwealth Office (FCO) Deputy Head (European Security), Security Policy Dept
2012 to 2014 FCO, Head of Australasia and Pacific, Asia Pacific Department
2012 FCO, Head of Common Security & Defence Policy, Europe Directorate
2008 to 2011 UK Mission to the UN Geneva, Second Secretary
2004 to 2007 Havana, Head of Political Section and Press & Public Affairs
2004 Secondment to the Spanish Ministry of Foreign Affairs
2003 to 2004 FCO, Desk Officer for Turkey, Europe Directorate
2002 to 2003 FCO, Desk Officer, Capital Unit, Finance Directorate
2002 Joined FCO
1997 to 2002 Private sector

The High Commissioner is the UK government’s representative in a Commonwealth nation. They are responsible for the direction and work of the High Commission and its Deputy High Commissions and/or Consulates, including political work, trade and investment, press and cultural relations, and visa and consular services.

The Deputy Head of Mission is a senior diplomat and typically a key advisor to the Ambassador or High Commissioner. The Deputy is responsible for the daily management of an overseas Embassy or High Commission. They will represent the UK’s interests in the absence of the Ambassador as Chargé d’Affaires.

The Ambassador represents His Majesty The King and the UK government in the country to which they are appointed. They are responsible for the direction and work of the Embassy and its Consulates, including political work, trade and investment, press and cultural relations, and visa and consular services.

role_appointments.title: Melanie Hopkins OBE - Acting British Ambassador to Brazil

Her previous role was as British High Commissioner to Fiji (and non-resident Ambassador/High Commissioner to a number of other Pacific countries) and Head of the UK’s network of 5 diplomatic missions. The Consul General is the senior UK official in a Consulate General, which is a subordinate office to the Embassy or High Commission, usually located in another major city. The Consul General represents the UK government and is typically responsible for consular, visa and trade activities in their city or region.

The Consul General leads the government’s work promoting UK economic, commercial, political and consular interests in New York, Pennsylvania, New Jersey and Fairfield County, Connecticut.

British Consulate General New York
